answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found a number of interlocal agreements for you to review. You can also contact the jurisdictions directly for more information about their particular agreement.
Huntersville, North Carolina:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/Document/4346
Arlington, Carrollton, and Grand Prairie, Texas:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/5393/CityNet_Project
Newbury, New London, and Sunapee, New Hampshire:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/6449/Intermunicipal_Agreement_for_Assessing_Services
Seattle and King County, Washington:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1644/City_and_County_Partnering_Opportunities
I have also included more information about the 2003 Program Excellence Award for Outstanding Partnerships dealing with intergovernmental cooperation.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2013/2003_Program_Excellence_Award_for_Outstanding_Partnerships_Intergovernmental_Cooperation_Interlocal_
Finally,  you might find these two documents useful as well. The first is a report by the national League of Cities called, “Guide to Successful Local Government Collaboration in America's Regions.”
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/Document/301761
The other is an ICMA report about interlocal service-sharing agreements.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1981/Interlocal_ServiceSharing_Agreements
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Eric Johnson
text:
Hillsborough County (Florida) and the City of Tampa will be jointly implementing an ERP – two governments with one solution. On the County side, this project reflects three participating agencies – the Board of County Commissioners, the Clerk of Circuit Court (the County CFO under Florida law), and a Civil Service Board. Thus, there are four “participating agencies” reflected in the contract that will be awarded. 
The software will be remote hosted by a private data center. An existing interlocal agreement and joint governance structure is being revisited as we prepare for a long term relationship and enter negotiations next month with the selected implementation partner. Alternative models for interlocal agreements and governance structure are sought. Information can be provided directly to Eric Johnson at johnsone@hillsboroughcounty.org 
Suggestions and “war stories” are appreciated as well.
title: Inquiry on Interlocal Agreement/Joint Governance of ERP
